Section.Paragraph: In this paper we study learning from a logical perspective. We show that there is a strong relationship between a learning strategy, its formal learning framework and its logical representational theory. This relationship enables one to translate learnability results from one theory to another. Moreover if we go from a classical logic theory to a substructural logic theory, we can transform learnability results of logical concepts to results for string languages. In this paper we will demonstrate such a translation by transforming the Valiant learnability result for boolean concepts to a learnability :result for a class of string pattern languages.
